title: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property
procedure: File a complaint at the nearest police station. Provide documents or proof of cheating. The police may register an FIR under IPC 420.

title: Sending offensive messages through communication service
procedure: Report it to the Cyber Crime Cell or online at cybercrime.gov.in. Share screenshots, user IDs, and message content as evidence.

title: Punishment for rape
procedure: Call 112 or visit the police. Get a medical exam immediately. You can file a complaint with a female officer and request legal aid.

title: Cruelty by husband or relatives of husband
procedure: You can report this at the women's cell or local police station. NGOs and women's helplines can also support. Legal protection under DV Act is available.

title: Sexual harassment of women at workplace
procedure: File a complaint with your companyâ€™s Internal Complaints Committee (ICC) within 3 months. If ICC is not present, report to the Local Committee (LC) in your district.

title: Attempt to murder
procedure: File an FIR with the police immediately. Collect any witness statements or medical records to support your case.

title: Theft
procedure: Report theft to the police. Include details like date, time, place, and what was stolen. Provide CCTV footage or eyewitnesses if available.

title: Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty
procedure: You can report such incidents at the police station or via 112. Medical examination and legal assistance will be provided immediately.

title: Defamation
procedure: If someone spreads false claims that harm your reputation, file a complaint under IPC 499. Civil and criminal remedies are available.
